docs.abstract: Joe Rhodes travel article recounts exhilarating weekend attending professional soccer matches in Vancouver, Seattle and Portland; in Pacific Northwest, Major League Soccer games are a stadium-filling, passionate phenomenon as teams compete for regional trophy, the Cascadia Cup.

headline.main: Soccer as Spectacle in the Pacific Northwest
headline.print_headline: Soccer (the Fans, Not the Players) as Spectacle

docs.snippet: Applications from transgender students and a Title IX ruling are forcing women’s colleges to reconsider admissions....
docs.lead_paragraph: Applications from transgender students and a Title IX ruling are forcing women’s colleges to reconsider admissions.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by reporter Kiera Feldman observes that women's colleges are struggling to reconcile their mission with growing societal shift on how gender itself is defined; notes that handful of applications from transgender women have rattled school administrators; calls on women's colleges to accept transgender women and thereby lead the way for society.

docs.snippet: The author of “No Book but the World” says the last book that made her furious was “The Da Vinci Code” — “At the end of every chapter, I’d glance up and announce in increasingly disgusted tones: ‘What schlock!’ ”...

docs.abstract: By the Book interview with author Leah Hager Cohen, whose book No Book but the World has been published.
